bugs.description: Potential division by zero error in FileStatus.getProgress() method. When currentPhaseMaxProgress is 0, the division operations on lines 57 and 60 will result in division by zero, which could cause NaN values or runtime errors.

Potential array access without bounds checking. In the addAtom method on line 97, the code accesses this.queries[0] without verifying that the array has elements after the addExpression() call. If addExpression() fails to add an element to the queries array, this will cause an undefined access error.

Potential null pointer exception in filterRulesDiffer function. The function accesses filterRulesA.length and filterRulesB.length on lines 34 and 37 without checking if these arrays are null or undefined. If either parameter is null/undefined, this will cause a runtime error.

Potential null pointer exception in queryParamsFromFilterRules function. On line 143, the code calls FILTER_RULE_TYPES.find() which can return undefined if no matching rule type is found. Then on line 144, it accesses ruleType.isnull_filtervar without checking if ruleType is undefined, which could cause a runtime error.

Potential null pointer exception in hexToRGB function. On line 102, the code calls hex.match(/.{1,2}/g) which can return null if the regex doesn't match. Then on lines 104-106, it accesses aRgbHex[0], aRgbHex[1], and aRgbHex[2] without checking if aRgbHex is null, which could cause a runtime error for invalid hex color strings.

Potential null pointer exception in list method. On line 53, the code iterates over extraParams using 'for (let extraParamKey in extraParams)' without first checking if extraParams is null or undefined. If extraParams is null/undefined, this will cause a runtime error.

Potential null pointer exception in CustomFieldQueryAtom operator setter. On line 71, the code accesses CUSTOM_FIELD_QUERY_VALUE_TYPES_BY_OPERATOR[operator] and then calls .split('|') on it. If the operator key doesn't exist in the object, this will return undefined, and calling .split() on undefined will cause a runtime error.
